recommendations: Chirdeep Shetty “I had the pleasure of working with Anupam for nearly 2 years years at Quintype. In his role as VP of Marketing, he consistently impressed the leadership team with his ability to effectively manage marketing and the inside sales team, Amazon MDF funds, and international lead generation. Anupam is a highly organized and strategic thinker, with a talent for creating and implementing successful marketing campaigns. He is a natural leader and is able to motivate and guide his team towards achieving their goals. One of Anupam's standout accomplishments was his management of the inside sales team. He was able to increase productivity and sales by implementing new processes and tools, and by providing ongoing training and support to his team. Anupam also excelled in his management of the Amazon MDF funds which were used to drive traffic and sales, resulting in significant growth for the company. In addition, Anupam played a key role in expanding the Quintype's international reach through his successful lead generation efforts. He was able to identify and target key markets, and develop effective campaigns to drive leads and sales in these regions. Overall, Anupam is an exceptional marketing professional and a valuable asset to any organization. I highly recommend him for any marketing leadership role.”

Puneet Arora “I found Anupam to be a diligent and smart marketing professional. His passion and commitment towards inbound marketing is commendable. He successfully led marketing initiatives that resulted in increased lead generation and greater brand visibility. Wishing Anupam all the best for his future endeavors!”
publications: [{"title":"Empowering Women at Workplace","subtitle":"Silicon India","date":"Jun 2019","description":"Article in a special issue of Silicon India magazine on Empowerment of Women at Workplace"},{"title":"Expert Forum - Parking Premium","subtitle":"Airport Focus International Magazine","date":"January 31, 2018","description":"Article on latest trends in Airport Car Parks business"},{"title":"Bangalore - Silicon Valley of India","subtitle":"ACI World Report","date":"June 10, 2017","description":"Airports Council International (ACI) is the only global trade representative of the world’s airports. Established in 1991, ACI represents airports interests with Governments and international organizations such as ICAO, develops standards, policies and recommended practices for airports, and provides information and training opportunities to raise standards around the world."},{"title":"From Yesterday","subtitle":"Leadstart Publishers","date":"March 9, 2017","description":"“From Yesterday” is Anupam’s second novel and was released in March 2017. The book revolves around the story of Anita, Adi and Christina set in the cities of Chennai and Chicago. The story evokes feelings of true love and sacrifice interlaced with the pangs of falling and separating in love.The book promises a breezy, soft and emotional read; something that Anupam looks to offer in his creations. The storyline is meshed with interesting titbits involving tarot cards, Chicago’s picturesque locales and of course Latin Dancing!"},{"title":"Extinction of Linear Equations","subtitle":"siliconindia.com","date":"December 19, 2013","description":"3D's of management consulting! Conceptualized and explained by Anupam Dasgupta in this article!"},{"title":"Fiction titled \"Salsa!\" - featured in leading newspapers like The Times of India, The Hindu, New Indian Express & Deccan Chronicle","subtitle":"India","date":"May 15, 2013","description":"Anupam’s debut novel, “Salsa” was published in 2013. The book was re-published as “Salsa – World is a Small Place” in 2014. The book was featured in leading Indian dailies like The Times of India, The New Indian Express, The Hindu and Deccan Chronicle. Besides leading bookstores and online portals, the book was also featured in national book fairs in Delhi, Kolkata, Ghaziabad, Bhubaneshwar, Jaipur.The story revolves around the lives of Vihaan and Mitali and their serendipitous meeting that creates memories for a lifetime. They move on with their respective lives, until they meet again eight years later. Originally intended to be a short story, the book is heavily inspired by Anupam’s own experience with co-incidental run-ins."}]
